FuncDef: The patch delete command deletes AP patches.
CLIs: patch delete all { { ap-id { <startapid> [ to <endapid> ] } &<1-10> } | all-ap }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a start AP ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8191.

Specifies an end AP ID. An end AP ID cannot be less than a start AP ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8192.

Examples: This will delete the patch. Are you sure? [Y/N]:y
Info: Operating, please wait for a moment...............done.
Info: Succeeded in deleting the patch of ap 1032.
Info: Succeeded in deleting the patch of ap 1033.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before installing a non-incremental patch, run the patch delete all command to delete the existing AP patches (including the patches of the master main control board, slave main control board, and all interface boards).
Configuration Impact
After the patch delete all command is run, AP patches in the system are deleted regardless of their status.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
Running the patch delete all command may affect system running. Exercise caution when running the command.When the patch delete all command is run to delete AP patches in the system, the system prompts you whether to delete patches.
